<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
OBITUARY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/29/remembering-tony-hsieh-former-zappos-ceo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Remembering Tony Hsieh, Former Zappos CEO and Bright Light of Business
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="LAS VEGAS, NV - MAY 14:  Zappos.com CEO Tony Hsieh (C) and members of Bl..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjUyL2JsdWVfbWFuX2dyb3VwX2FuZF96YXBwb3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Becker/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The biz world lost one of its most original thinkers on Friday, when former Zappos CEO Tony Hsieh <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/11/28/939697651/tony-hsieh-former-zappos-ceo-dies-at-46?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died</a> from injuries related to a house fire. He was 46. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a </span><span><a href="https://www.zappos.com/e/celebrating-tony?pf_rd_r=8506F54544A14D348B7E&pf_rd_p=f021b9ec-f559-4263-a6e3-c07b8bbcfe92&utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">statement</a></span><span> the company said, "The world has lost a tremendous visionary and an incredible human being." </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Quick bio</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 1995, Hsieh (pronounced "shay") cofounded the internet ad company LinkExchange with a fellow Harvard alum. Three years later, at just 24 years old, he sold it to Microsoft for $265 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hsieh then started a fund and invested in the online shoe seller Zappos (then known as ShoeSite.com), later becoming its CEO. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>ShoeSite.com was founded by a film school grad, Nick Swinmurn, who realized that people didn't need to try on shoes before buying them. His </span><span><a href="https://footwearnews.com/2009/business/news/zappos-milestone-qa-with-nick-swinmurn-90543/?stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">key statistic</a></span><span>: In 1998, 5% of the U.S.' $40 billion shoe business was being done through mail order. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hsieh took over and built an e-comm shoe colossus. In 2000, the site did $1.6 million in sales. Nine years later...<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/28/obituaries/tony-hsieh-dead.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $1 billion</a>. It was then, in 2009, that Amazon scooped up Zappos for $1.2 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"The world lost you way too soon," Jeff Bezos </span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CIJYUQhHzLq/?igshid=1gk7v70ismywh&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a></span><span> on Instagram. "Your curiosity, vision, and relentless focus on customers leave an indelible mark."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Hsieh is being remembered for his singular commitment to customer service and for creating a unique company culture. At Zappos, he installed a self-management system called "<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/19/business/at-zappos-selling-shoes-and-a-vision.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Holacracy</a>," which eliminated most traditional corporate hierarchy and allowed anyone to set meeting agendas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hsieh also had an outsized impact on the city of <a href="https://www.reviewjournal.com/business/former-zappos-ceo-downtown-las-vegas-visionary-tony-hsieh-dies-at-46-2193165/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Las Vegas</a>, where he invested hundreds of millions of dollars in revitalizing the downtown area. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more on Tony:</strong> His episode on the podcast, <a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/zappos-tony-hsieh/id1150510297?i=1000438833707&s=09&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>How I Built This</em></a>; Zappos's <a href="https://twitter.com/digitallynativ/status/1332689158209482753?s=09&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">operating principles</a> (#1: "Deliver WOW Through Service"); and his book, <a href="https://bookshop.org/books/delivering-happiness-a-path-to-profits-passion-and-purpose/9780446576222?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Delivering Happiness</em></a>. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/29/black-friday-like-cyber-friday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Scene on Black Friday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Amazon fulfillment center " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjUzL2FtYXpvbl9mdWxmaWxsbWVudF9jZW50ZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Matthew Horwood/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What, were you expecting a shopping mall stampede? The more accurate representation of Black Friday, this year and perhaps from now on, is an Amazon fulfillment center. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just read <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-shopping-coronavirus-pandemic-online-shopping-790e862ab1101e3d73e30a99ab04b70e?utm_source=Twitter&utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_medium=AP&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">these stats</a>: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>U.S. store visits fell harder than Nate Robinson—down 52% on Black Friday, per retail tracker Sensormatic Solutions. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shopping on U.S. retail websites, however, rose 22% over last year to $9 billion, according to Adobe Analytics. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And today is Cyber Monday. With estimated spending of $10.8 billion to $12.7 billion, it's expected to be the largest online sales day in the country's history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The pandemic rolled out the red carpet for widespread e-commerce adoption. Consider that Amazon has <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/27/technology/pushed-by-pandemic-amazon-goes-on-a-hiring-spree-without-equal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hired 427,300 new employees</a> in the past 10 months, roughly 1,400 a day. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/30/nyc-reopen-schools-next-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NYC Gives Parents Whiplash
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Empty desk and classrooms" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzE0L2VtcHR5X2Rlc2tfYW5kX2NsYXNzcm9vbXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Next week, NYC will begin reopening preschools, kindergartens, and elementary schools, with middle and high schools to follow later, Mayor Bill de Blasio's office <a href="https://www.nydailynews.com/coronavirus/ny-covid-new-york-city-schools-bill-de-blasio-20201129-vmcvihg6x5g33o3enlzovt3ju4-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday. That's quite the U-turn from Nov. 19, when the city closed schools after its Covid positivity rate hit 3%. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That decision angered some residents because indoor dining, bars, and gyms—which studies show are greater virus spreaders—remained open. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NYC will also abandon that 3% threshold and increase Covid-19 testing for students. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Leaders everywhere are wrestling with this</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Without federal guidance, the decision to open schools <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/11/28/covid-schools-open-rhode-island/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">falls on</a> state and local officials. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Rhode Island bars, gyms, theaters, and some other businesses will close...but the state has opted to keep schools open. While Michigan closed high schools earlier this month, middle and elementary schools remain open. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Twelve states have complete or partial closures of in-person learning as of Nov. 25, </span><span><a href="https://www.edweek.org/ew/section/multimedia/map-covid-19-schools-open-closed.html?s_kwcid=AL!6416!3!455874877102!b!!g!!schools%20open&gclid=Cj0KCQiAqo3-BRDoARIsAE5vnaIkjkqA14fFf4Bhp9WcKOk4JCdGmnZDnOwdb0V5dDh1ltpRibtedhwaAvS6EALw_wcB&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Education Week</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lessons from abroad: </strong>Several European countries reimposed lockdowns on businesses and gatherings but <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/11/13/934153674/lessons-from-europe-where-cases-are-rising-but-schools-are-open?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">left schools</a> open this fall. On Friday, the WHO said it appears those measures have slowed the spike in cases. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/30/eu-uk-just-1-month-left-make-brexit-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Honk If Brexit Negotiations Are Confusing You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A line of freight lorries queueing along the highway waiting to access the Eurotunnel." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjU0L2JyZXhpdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gareth Fuller/PA Images via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With just one month left to reach a deal protecting ~$1 trillion worth of trade between the EU and UK, this is shaping up to be a critical week for <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu/britain-expects-very-significant-week-for-brexit-talks-as-clock-ticks-down-idUSKBN2890FM?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brexit negotiations</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's left to <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-55106114?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hammer out</a>: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fishing rights.</strong></span><span> Despite making up just 0.1% of the British economy, it's been a tough nut. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Competition.</strong></span><span> The EU loves its single market more than mulled wine and wants the UK to play by the same rules. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Parliament and EU leaders don't ratify a deal, they'll be trading under the WTO's tariff-heavy rules come Jan. 1—when Britain formally leaves the EU's economic embrace. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A "no-deal" Brexit </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/brexit-global-trade-coronavirus-pandemic-london-china-25ab08a597a834ca2bd395f0863b55a2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could drop</a></span><span> 2021 UK GDP an additional 2% and put an extra burden on financial services and export-reliant manufacturers.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It'll also test truckers' bladders. The UK warned Brexit may cause long delays at the Eurotunnel leading to the EU. When France started a trial run of post-Brexit checks this weekend (see image above), trucks were <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2020/nov/24/trial-of-brexit-border-checks-causes-five-mile-lorry-queues-in-kent?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backed up</a> as if a new In-N-Out location had just opened.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Brexit coming down to the wire has compounded three years of uncertainty for British companies that still don't know how to prepare. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/29/week-ahead-november-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>This Friday, we'll get the big November employment numbers. Except they probably won't be big—economists expect a weaker U.S. job market than in the previous few months due to the resurgent virus and accompanying restrictions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Oil deliberations: </strong>OPEC+ ministers will meet early this week to discuss a potential delay of their planned output hike. The price of oil has <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/global-oil-int/oil-prices-post-weekly-gain-ahead-of-opec-meeting-idUSKBN28703R?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained</a> for four straight weeks on hopes that a Covid-19 vaccine will lead to a quicker economic recovery and greater demand for fuel.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Zoom will report Q3 financials today, Salesforce (following <a href="https://www.zdnet.com/article/salesforce-and-slack-a-vision-of-collaborative-sales-service-with-a-dash-of-microsoft-defense/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rumors</a> it's in talks to acquire Slack) is up Tuesday, and recently IPOed Snowflake will report Wednesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vaccine distribution: </strong>On Tuesday, a CDC advisory panel <a href="https://apnews.com/article/us-news-immunizations-coronavirus-pandemic-8362102972fa486259b27b3f188c0a73?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will meet</a> to decide which groups will get priority access to the limited, initial doses of a coronavirus vaccine.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tuesday is the first day of December. It's also Giving Tuesday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Wednesday, the </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-mcrib-to-return-nationally-in-2020-sparking-celebration-2020-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">McRib is coming back</a></span><span> to McDonald's. </span>
</li>
</ul>

BREW'S BETS
</h3>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Dive back into the week:</strong><strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Shallow dive: </strong></span><span>soothing video of a </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-aCJtxibSpA&feature=youtu.be&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guy making lasagna</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday morning inspiration: </strong>Vanderbilt senior Sarah Fuller became the first woman to play in a Power Five college football game on Saturday. "I just want to tell all the girls out there that you can do anything you set your mind to," <a href="https://twitter.com/SportsCenter/status/1332780792301432833?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">she said</a> postgame. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Two eye-popping visuals: </strong><a href="https://twitter.com/undertheraedar/status/1332733136715780096?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This map</a> offers a look at population density across the world. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nRemembering Tony Hsieh, Former Zappos CEO and Bright Light of Business\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"LAS VEGAS, NV - MAY 14:  Zappos.com CEO Tony Hsieh (C) and members of style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDavid Becker/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe biz world lost one of its most original thinkers on Friday, when former Zappos CEO Tony Hsieh \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/11/28/939697651/tony-hsieh-former-zappos-ceo-dies-at-46?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied\u003c/a\u003e from injuries related to a house fire. He was 46. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.zappos.com/e/celebrating-tony?pf_rd_r=8506F54544A14D348B7E\u0026pf_rd_p=f021b9ec-f559-4263-a6e3-c07b8bbcfe92\u0026utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the company said, \"The world has lost a tremendous visionary and an incredible human being.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eQuick bio\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 1995, Hsieh (pronounced \"shay\") cofounded the internet ad company LinkExchange with a fellow Harvard alum. Three years later, at just 24 years old, he sold it to Microsoft for $265 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHsieh then started a fund and invested in the online shoe seller Zappos (then known as ShoeSite.com), later becoming its CEO. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eShoeSite.com was founded by a film school grad, Nick Swinmurn, who realized that people didn't need to try on shoes before buying them. His \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://footwearnews.com/2009/business/news/zappos-milestone-qa-with-nick-swinmurn-90543/?stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekey statistic\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: In 1998, 5% of the U.S.' $40 billion shoe business was being done through mail order. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHsieh took over and built an e-comm shoe colossus. In 2000, the site did $1.6 million in sales. Nine years later...\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/28/obituaries/tony-hsieh-dead.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e. It was then, in 2009, that Amazon scooped up Zappos for $1.2 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"The world lost you way too soon,\" Jeff Bezos \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CIJYUQhHzLq/?igshid=1gk7v70ismywh\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Instagram. \"Your curiosity, vision, and relentless focus on customers leave an indelible mark.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Hsieh is being remembered for his singular commitment to customer service and for creating a unique company culture. At Zappos, he installed a self-management system called \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/19/business/at-zappos-selling-shoes-and-a-vision.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHolacracy\u003c/a\u003e,\" which eliminated most traditional corporate hierarchy and allowed anyone to set meeting agendas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHsieh also had an outsized impact on the city of \u003ca href=\"https://www.reviewjournal.com/business/former-zappos-ceo-downtown-las-vegas-visionary-tony-hsieh-dies-at-46-2193165/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLas Vegas\u003c/a\u003e, where he invested hundreds of millions of dollars in revitalizing the downtown area. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For more on Tony:\u003c/strong\u003e His episode on the podcast, \u003ca href=\"https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/zappos-tony-hsieh/id1150510297?i=1000438833707\u0026s=09\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow I Built This\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e; Zappos's \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/digitallynativ/status/1332689158209482753?s=09\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoperating principles\u003c/a\u003e (#1: \"Deliver WOW Through Service\"); and his book, \u003ca href=\"https://bookshop.org/books/delivering-happiness-a-path-to-profits-passion-and-purpose/9780446576222?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eDelivering Happiness\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F29%2Fremembering-tony-hsieh-former-zappos-ceo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjUzL2FtYXpvbl9mdWxmaWxsbWVudF9jZW50ZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMatthew Horwood/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat, were you expecting a shopping mall stampede? The more accurate representation of Black Friday, this year and perhaps from now on, is an Amazon fulfillment center. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust read \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-shopping-coronavirus-pandemic-online-shopping-790e862ab1101e3d73e30a99ab04b70e?utm_source=Twitter\u0026utm_campaign=SocialFlow\u0026utm_medium=AP\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethese stats\u003c/a\u003e: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. store visits fell harder than Nate Robinson—down 52% on Black Friday, per retail tracker Sensormatic Solutions. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShopping on U.S. retail websites, however, rose 22% over last year to $9 billion, according to Adobe Analytics. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd today is Cyber Monday. With estimated spending of $10.8 billion to $12.7 billion, it's expected to be the largest online sales day in the country's history.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe pandemic rolled out the red carpet for widespread e-commerce adoption. Consider that Amazon has \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/27/technology/pushed-by-pandemic-amazon-goes-on-a-hiring-spree-without-equal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehired 427,300 new employees\u003c/a\u003e in the past 10 months, roughly 1,400 a day. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F29%2Fblack-friday-like-cyber-friday\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=U.S.+store+visits+fell+52%25+as+shoppers+flocked+to+websites+\u0026url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/29/black-friday-like-cyber-friday\u0026via=MorningBrew\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzE0L2VtcHR5X2Rlc2tfYW5kX2NsYXNzcm9vbXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNext week, NYC will begin reopening preschools, kindergartens, and elementary schools, with middle and high schools to follow later, Mayor Bill de Blasio's office \u003ca href=\"https://www.nydailynews.com/coronavirus/ny-covid-new-york-city-schools-bill-de-blasio-20201129-vmcvihg6x5g33o3enlzovt3ju4-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. That's quite the U-turn from Nov. 19, when the city closed schools after its Covid positivity rate hit 3%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat decision angered some residents because indoor dining, bars, and gyms—which studies show are greater virus spreaders—remained open. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNYC will also abandon that 3% threshold and increase Covid-19 testing for students. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLeaders everywhere are wrestling with this\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWithout federal guidance, the decision to open schools \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/11/28/covid-schools-open-rhode-island/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efalls on\u003c/a\u003e state and local officials. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, Rhode Island bars, gyms, theaters, and some other businesses will close...but the state has opted to keep schools open. While Michigan closed high schools earlier this month, middle and elementary schools remain open. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTwelve states have complete or partial closures of in-person learning as of Nov. 25, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.edweek.org/ew/section/multimedia/map-covid-19-schools-open-closed.html?s_kwcid=AL!6416!3!455874877102!b!!g!!schools%20open\u0026gclid=Cj0KCQiAqo3-BRDoARIsAE5vnaIkjkqA14fFf4Bhp9WcKOk4JCdGmnZDnOwdb0V5dDh1ltpRibtedhwaAvS6EALw_wcB\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Education Week\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLessons from abroad: \u003c/strong\u003eSeveral European countries reimposed lockdowns on businesses and gatherings but \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/11/13/934153674/lessons-from-europe-where-cases-are-rising-but-schools-are-open?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleft schools\u003c/a\u003e open this fall. On Friday, the WHO said it appears those measures have slowed the spike in cases. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
